course_title: Sem: Personality & Social Psych: AdvSem in Attitudes&Persuasion
class_notes:
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


The aim of this online, upper-level seminar (sub in 'Senior seminar' if we need to specify) is to provide an introduction to basic theory and research regarding attitudes and persuasion. The focus will be on how attitudes form, the functions that they serve, how they are measured, how they are changed, and their relation to/impact on information processing, judgment, and behavior. Weekly coursework will involve reading and writing about assigned scholarly articles, which will then be discussed during class time. Prior completion of PSYC200W is required; completion of PSYC212 is strongly encouraged. Enrollment by permission of the instructor.
course_description: Selected issues in personality theory and research.
sections: Class Nbr: 3999, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:20a-12:35p, Instructor: J. Barber, Status: Open
